Merge pull request #92 from mozilla/onboarding-refactor

Refactoring of onboarding code (better fix for #91)

Refactoring of onboarding code

There are several methods that rely on the simple pref that marks the onboarding as complete. #91 alters the way the simple pref is used, which causes several issues. This commit fixes the issue that #91 fixes, but in a way which does not break the methods that depend specific usage of the onboarding pref.

The key change is that the tabs event listener that calls the endOnboard method is now the onOpen listener, rather than the onReady. onOpen fires immediately when the tab opens, while onReady fires once the page is completely loaded. Use of onReady contributed to the repeated onboarding events some users expirienced, as closing the tab before it loads completely would mean the onboarding complete pref was never set to true.

Testing using the same procedures as #91, namely simulating a 100% loss network on my computer and installing the addon on a fresh firefox build (to test closing the onboarding tab before it fully loads), showed that this commit fixes the issue of repeated onboarding events. Additionally, the methods that rely on the onboarding pref are not broken in this commit, as the usage of the pref is returned to the way it was previously.

Merge pull request #91 from mozilla/onboarding-bug

Resolve onboarding bug where wikipedia is opened on every startup

Resolve onboarding bug where wikipedia is opened on every startup

I'm using simple prefs to note that the onboarding event (where wikipedia is opened) has occurred. Previously the pref was set after the page had fully loaded, meaning that if users closed the wikipedia tab early (on a slow internet connection), the onboarding event would not be marked as complete. Therefore I've moved the pref set to as soon as the onboard method is called, eliminating this race condition.

I replicated the issue by simulating a very slow internet connection on my computer and testing the addon. This PR fixes the issue in my testing.
Use pageshow instead of ready Closes #88
Use classlist instead of setAttribute

Merge pull request #84 from mozilla/remove-mouseover

Add stylesheet for button, remove mouseover / mouseout

Add stylesheet for button, remove mouseover / mouseout

The styles for the enhance button were moved into a css file that is applied using the sdk style sheet service. This means that the button styles no longer need to be applied with js, and in particular, :hover can be used, so that the mouseover / mouseout listeners can be removed from the js.

Merge pull request #82 from mozilla/multiprocess

Specify addon is multiprocess compatible
mark as e10s compatible

Remove innerHTML assignments (XSS vulnerability)

innerHTML assignment has been replaced with textContent assignment to remove XSS attack vector

Closes #80

Merge pull request #78 from mozilla/fix-cleanup

Fix Cleanup Function so that addon can uninstall itself

Only call Rec.destroy if Rec != null

Previously Rec.destroy was being called on every call to cleanup function. The cleanup function is used in the uninstall process. When rec.destroy was called when Rec == null (set to null on first pass of cleanup function), the cleanup function would fail and the addon would not uninstall itself. The survey would then be displayed on the next startup, the cleanup function would fail again. There is now a check to only call Rec.destroy if it is not null (where if rec == null, rec.destroy has already been called)

Closes #77

Closes #73

Merge pull request #68 from mozilla/handle-button-click-logging

Keep track of panel state, don't always call "showPanel"

Use sdk/panel onOpen event listener

When the panel is constructed, Recommend.js's handlePanelOpen is specified as the callback function for whenever the panel opens. The telemetry logging for panel open events is done here. This way, Recommend.js does not have to keep track of the state of the panel.

Closes #66

Merge pull request #67 from mozilla/use-hidden-properly

Hide items with 'hidden' class, not attribute

Hide items with 'hidden' class, not attribute

Elements that are hidden now have a hidden class applied. Style selection by id has also been removed and replaced with style selection by class. The 'classList' property is now used for adding and removing classes.

Closes #65

Fix onboarding event bugs

The onboarding event was trying to provide a recommendation for weather.com, when the weather.com add-on had been removed from the set of recommendations.

Additionally, the onboarding event now uses the waitForWindow method for showing the panel at the correct time, rather than trying to manually force open a panel.

Closes #46

clear out customizeableUI widget cache

The CustomizableUI cache of button nodes on uninstall by using CustomizableUI destroyWidget method. Notably, the createWidget method is NOT use since this has undesirable side-effects such as listing the button in the customize panel.
